newsitem.title: UK: VODAFONE OFF LOWS AFTER RESULTS.
newsitem.headline: VODAFONE OFF LOWS AFTER RESULTS.

text.p: Shares in Vodafone Group Plc were steady and well above lows on Tuesday after the mobile telephone company reported a 13 percent rise in full-year, pre-tax profit.
The shares were trading unchanged on the day at 271-1/2p by 1340 GMT after an earlier low of 265p.
"The figures are on the upper end of forecasts," one trader said, adding the outlook for Vodaphone seemed to be satisfactory.
Vodafone said its pre-tax profit in the year to March 31 rose to 539 million pounds from 475 million pounds. Analysts had expected a figure between 525 and 543 million pounds.
The company, which expects to gain up to 400,000 new GSM-subscribers in Britain this year, said average revenue per customer dropped during the 12-month period, however.
